blocks.text: In these final three sessions we are going to lean into the third core value of “BELONG” and how our love for God and neighbors is lived out together in a welcoming spiritual family.
Our mission at Neighborhood Church is to love God and our neighbors together. That “together” is not an afterthought - it is the beautiful way God designed His people to grow, serve, and multiply.

items: Loving God → We desire to BE God’s satisfied children, love Him, and glorify Him.
And our neighbors → We desire to BLESS others where we live, work, and play.
Together → We BELONG to a welcoming spiritual family.

blocks.text: As we grow in our relationship with the Father, we are built into a spiritual family that holds one another up, encourages one another, and multiplies together. This is the orchard - roots deep in Christ, branches reaching out to bless, and fruit that multiplies for the Kingdom.
Session #8
Belonging to the Spiritual Family

So then you are no longer strangers and aliens, but you are fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God, built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the cornerstone, in whom the whole structure, being joined together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord. In him you also are being built together into a dwelling place for God by the Spirit.

And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works, not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another, and all the more as you see the Day drawing near.

blocks.text: Summary Teaching

We are no longer strangers and aliens - we are family! God has made us members of His household, built together on the foundation of Christ the cornerstone. This belonging is not optional; it is the beautiful way God designed His people to grow, encourage one another, and multiply.

In the early church they devoted themselves to teaching, fellowship, breaking bread, and prayer. They met in homes, shared everything, ate together with glad hearts, and the Lord added to their number daily. That same welcoming family spirit is alive at Neighborhood Church today.
When we belong well, we stir one another up to love and good works. We hold each other up like trees in an orchard - roots deep in Christ, branches reaching out, fruit multiplying for the Kingdom.
